review: In a market glutted with overpriced works about Chinese wooden toilet seats, I found this one to have a much more conversational tone than "Mandarin Toilet Seat Wars!" and more footnotes than "Yellow Peril, Brown Movement."While it is slightly more expensive than a single family home in China, I think the extra price is worth it, because right now I'm high.Can't wait for the companion piece "The 2009-2014 Outlook for Urinal Cakes in Greater China." I'm pissed it isn't out yet.I'm deducting one star because I would have liked a section about Lesser China, and this only focused on Greater China. Seems like the comprehensive tome still has yet to be written. Also, I didn't like the Scratch N Sniff parts.
productTitle: The 2009-2014 Outlook for Wood Toilet Seats in Greater China
